title: Preparing data for analysis
text: data study collected online among several studies mental imagery Inner Experience Lab website. multi-study online project designed people participate various studies seamlessly without fill information questionnaires multiple times. , survey data given participant (demographics, questionnaires, feedbacks, etc.) come different studies. central data extraction pipeline designed extract merge survey data different studies isolating specific experiment data study. code central pipeline separate private repository, data studies private OSF repository (obvious privacy ownership reasons). source data present study retrieved OSF repository using private token (available public GitHub repository). code operations, however, publicly available package files data-raw/ folder: 01_import_osf_data.R, common survey data set (collected survey data participant, irrelevant) source experiment data specific study (questionably clean variable names irrelevant variables) imported private OSF repository inst/extdata/ folder package. 02_create_package_data.R, two source data sets undergo basic cleaning steps select, organise rename relevant variables. Another crucial step creation various logical variables flag participants specific characteristics based information typed manually demographic feedback questionnaires. IDs identified manually hard coded script. variables : has_adhd: whether participant ADHD has_asd: whether participant ASD has_dyslexia: whether participant dyslexia has_other_neuro_trouble: whether participant neurological troubles (rare unique cases sample) has_treatment: whether participant treatment neurological trouble has_been_distracted: whether participant distracted experiment, lacked focus, gave , etc. has_cheated: whether participant used external help answer questions (e.g. paper, calculator, etc.) self-reports, observed participants seemed usually honest (e.g., three admitted used external help tools), observe systematic bias data based variables1. Finally, native package data created data/ folder using usethis::use_data(), saves data format tailored use R packages. two data sets, experiment_data survey_data, constitute proper raw data (necessarily good data, understandable usable data). 03_export_to_osf.R, raw_data.xlsx Excel file created easier sharing. three raw data files (experiment_data.rda, survey_data.rda, raw_data.xlsx) uploaded public OSF repository dedicated study. data available natively package experiment_data survey_data objects. raw data sets directly available upon loading package: details variables data sets can found help files, accessible ?experiment_data ?survey_data.

what: From raw data to clean data
title: Preparing data for analysis
text: haven’t shared “processed” “clean” filtered data OSF repository wanted make outlier detection removal steps transparent explicit code, anyone can reproduce analyses -adapt explore alternatives (including, instance, choosing analyse participants excluded, exclude different participants). also motivated fact creating clean data set can done lines code appropriate function. function designed get_clean_data(), wrapper around pipeline described . Jumping directly final product, code creates clean data: data frames columns raw ones, albeit different variable types formats (string variables converted factors appropriate levels contrasts, response times converted seconds, etc.), less participants (rows) outliers removed data. verbose output chunk spoils process, let’s explain bit detail. get_clean_data() function wrapper around pipeline made several functions filter format data. main steps : filter_random_accuracy_ids(): function filters participants answered randomly low accuracy. uses threshold 0.5 accuracy, meaning participants answered less 50% questions correctly removed. filter_manually_identified_ids(): function filters participants based various characteristics, including manually retrieved survey data (described previous part). option include exclude criterion controlled function arguments (see function documentation details). default, chose exclude participants complete mandatory questionnaires tests (VVIQ, OSIVQ Raven), reported cheating distractions experiment, chose keep participants neurological psychiatric conditions. decision based fact several studies suspect link aphantasia forms neurodivergences psychiatric conditions. indeed case, prove nonsensical exclude participants conditions, may actually ones interested studying. filter_suspicious_rt_ids(): function filters participants suspiciously fast response times. calculates median response time participant compares sample mean median response times. Participants median response times 2.25 standard deviations mean considered suspiciously fast removed data. specific threshold chosen based visual examination distributions manually checking data. two participants excluded step clearly spammed end experiment. participant close (2 SDs, 2.25 SDs) fast response times, remained stable across experiment, decent accuracy overall. participant motivated shift 2 2.25 SDs. plotting function designed wrap ggplot visual examination:  factor_categories(): function factors category variable experiment data, indicates type problem presented participant (visual, spatial, control). factor_groups(): function factors Group variable experiment data, indicates group participant belongs (Aphants, Hypophants, Typical imagers, Hyperphants). n_groups argument allows different groupings based VVIQ scores, options 2, 3, 4 groups. factor_strategies(): function factors strategy variables survey data, optionally ordered factors. factor_chr_vars(): function factors character variables experiment data, converting factors appropriate levels. compute_nieq_scores(): function computes NIEQ scores survey data, used assess participants’ inner experience characteristics. questionnaire part another online experiment central present study, included exploratory purposes. Finally, cleaned data returned list containing two data frames: df_expe df_survey. df_expe data frame contains cleaned experiment data, df_survey data frame contains cleaned survey data. Data set analyses!
code: clean_data <- get_clean_data(verbose = TRUE) #>  #> Sample size before accuracy analysis: 137 #> Participants below random accuracy (<= 50%): 8 (5.84%) #>  #> Sample size before manual examination: 137 #> Manually identified participants: #> - N without VVIQ: 3 -> Excluded #> - N without OSIVQ: 6 -> Excluded #> - N without Raven: 2 -> Excluded #> - N who cheated: 3 -> Excluded #> - N who were distracted: 12 -> Excluded #> - N who had treatment: 4 -> Included #> - N with ADHD: 7 -> Included #> - N with ASD: 5 -> Included #> - N with dyslexia: 2 -> Included #> - N with other neuro troubles: 2 -> Included #> Participants to exclude: 24 (17.52%) #>  #> Sample size before median RTs analysis: 106 #> Participants with median RTs outside 2.25 SDs: 2 (1.89%)  df_expe   <- clean_data$df_expe df_survey <- clean_data$df_survey # Get clean data without filtering based on median RTs (for demonstration) df <- get_clean_data(sd_mult = 99)$df_expe  plot_median_rt_distribution(df, sd_mult = 2.25)

title: Wrapper function to get clean
text: n_groups number groups factor data. Must 2, 3 4. 2 divides sample Aphants Typical imagers using 32 VVIQ criterio, 3 divides sample Aphants (VVIQ = 16), Hypophants (VVIQ < 32) Typical imagers, 4 also isolates Hyperphants VVIQ > 75. exclude_no_vviq Logical, whether exclude participants without VVIQ. exclude_no_osivq Logical, whether exclude participants without OSIVQ. exclude_no_raven Logical, whether exclude participants without Raven. exclude_cheated Logical, whether exclude participants cheated (based self-report). exclude_distracted Logical, whether exclude participants distracted (based self-report). exclude_treatment Logical, whether exclude participants treatment neurological psychiatric disorder. exclude_adhd Logical, whether exclude participants ADHD. exclude_asd Logical, whether exclude participants ASD. exclude_dyslexia Logical, whether exclude participants dyslexia. exclude_other Logical, whether exclude participants neurological troubles. sd_mult numeric value indicating many standard deviations use identifying suspicious median RTs. default 2.25, means median RTs 2.25 standard deviations inferior mean considered suspiciously fast potential "spamming". verbose logical value indicating whether print verbose messages filtering process. Default FALSE.

what: Simulate accuracy data for the factorial design — simulate_acc_data
title: Simulate accuracy data for the factorial design — simulate_acc_data
text: function simulates accuracy data factorial design experiment. designed potential power analyses accuracy data, ended unused due lack previous data base analyses . power analyses conducted RT data instead. creates data frame following columns: id: unique identifier subject. Group: group subject belongs (aphantasia typical). category: category trial (visual, spatial, control). trial: trial number (1 9). accuracy: accuracy subject's response (1 correct, 0 incorrect). Inspired Lisa DeBruine.

title: Participant's questionnaire data — survey_data
text: dataset contains responses questionnaires collected participants. gathered several online experiments ran simulatneously innerexperiencelab.com website. contains following: encrypted unique participant id (also allows join data experiment data) language experiment conducted (FR EN) age gender Group (aphantasia, hypophantasia, typical, hyperphantasia no_vviq) country language_native (native language participant) language_usual (language participant usually uses) job (job participant) vviq_is_complete (whether participant completed VVIQ) vviq_total_score (total score VVIQ) VVIQ items osivq_is_complete (whether participant completed OSIVQ) osivq_object, osivq_spatial, osivq_verbal (mean scores OSIVQ subscales) OSIVQ items raven_is_complete (whether participant completed Raven's Progressive Matrices) raven_score (score Raven's Progressive Matrices) nieq_is_complete (whether participant completed NIEQ) NIEQ items two "frequency" "proportion" sub-scales *_false_info (self-report whether participant provided false information questionnaires, people usually honest ) met_issues (self-report whether participant encountered issues experiment) *_external_support (self-report whether participant used external support experiment, e.g. paper) strats_* (self-report strategies used participant experiment) has_adhd (self-report whether participant ADHD) has_asd (self-report whether participant ASD) has_dyslexia (self-report whether participant dyslexia) has_other_neuro_trouble (self-report whether participant neurological troubles) has_treatment (self-report whether participant treatment neurological trouble) has_been_distracted (self-report whether participant distracted experiment) has_cheated (self-report whether participant used external help answer questions)

what: Theme for elegant scientific vector figures — theme_pdf
title: Theme for elegant scientific vector figures — theme_pdf
text: function creates ggplot2 theme based guidelines Nature Branded Research Journals. takes default ggplot2 theme argument applies mostly size adjustments text elements. option use custom fonts Google Fonts also built-, chosen default "Montserrat". recommended NRJ, base text size set 7pt text sizes inferior 7pt. exception defaults title size, used journal figures anyway. rest theme designed make figures look good confined restricted spaces (88mm width one column 180mm two columns).

title: Theme for elegant scientific vector figures — theme_pdf
code: theme_pdf(   base_theme = ggplot2::theme_classic,   family = "Montserrat",   base_size = 7,   base_line = 0.2,   title_hjust = 0.5,   axis_relative_size = 0.85,   axis_relative_x = 1,   axis_relative_y = 1,   legend_relative = 1,   ... )

title: Theme for elegant scientific vector figures — theme_pdf
text: base_theme ggplot2 theme function, without parentheses quotes. default ggplot2::theme_classic. family string name font family used theme. found sysfonts::font_add_google(), font reset default "sans" font (close Arial). base_size numeric value base font size points. default 7pt, recommended NRJ. base_line numeric value base line size points. default 0.2pt look good small vector figures. title_hjust numeric value horizontal justification plot title subtitle. default 0.5, centers title. axis_relative_size numeric value relative size axis text compared base size. default 0.85, slightly smaller base size. axis_relative_x, axis_relative_y numeric value relative size x/y-axis text compared axis text size (already depends base size). arguments allow dissociate size x y axes' texts. defaults 1. legend_relative numeric value relative size legend text compared base size. default 1. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::theme() (can override defaults set ).

title: Theme for elegant scientific vector figures — theme_pdf
text: ggplot2 theme object specified settings.

title: Theme for elegant scientific vector figures — theme_pdf
code: p <-   iris |>   dplyr::mutate(Species = stringr::str_to_title(Species)) |>   ggplot2::ggplot(     ggplot2::aes(       x = Sepal.Length,       y = Sepal.Width,       color = Species,       fill  = Species,       size = Petal.Width    )  ) +  ggplot2::geom_jitter(alpha = 0.5) +  ggplot2::labs(   title    = "Iris Dataset",   subtitle = "A classic dataset for testing",   caption  = "Source: R's built-in iris dataset",   x = "Sepal Length (cm)",   y = "Sepal Width (cm)"  ) +  ggplot2::scale_color_manual(   values = palette.colors(palette = "Okabe-Ito")[c(1, 2, 3)]  ) +  ggplot2::scale_size_continuous(range = c(1, 2.5))   p + ggplot2::facet_wrap(~ Species) + theme_pdf(ggplot2::theme_bw)   p + theme_pdf(   family = "Roboto Slab",   base_size = 12,   legend.position = "right"  )
